trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Certificates and Keys
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Certificates and Keys

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Certificates and Keys
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Certificates and Keys

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can configure <token>secondref_acs</token> certificates and keys using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: You can configure <token>secondref_acs</token> certificates and keys using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Working with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can be more efficient if you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or if you want to automate the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.
trans-unit.target: Working with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can be more efficient if you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> or if you want to automate the onboarding of a new tenant for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure certificates and keys, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure certificates and keys, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.

trans-unit.source: Steps for Configuring Certificates and Keys Using the ACS Management Service
trans-unit.target: Steps for Configuring Certificates and Keys Using the ACS Management Service

trans-unit.source: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.
trans-unit.target: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure certificates and keys using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure certificates and keys using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect ACS Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect ACS Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Create a Sample Console Application
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Create a Sample Console Application

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client

trans-unit.source: Step 5 - Install Certificates and Keys
trans-unit.target: Step 5 - Install Certificates and Keys

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Certificate for Your Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Certificate for Your Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Certificate for a Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Certificate for a Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for Your Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for Your Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for a Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for a Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Encryption Certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Encryption Certificate

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Decryption Certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Decryption Certificate

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect <token>secondref_acs</token> Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect <token>secondref_acs</token> Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to collect the necessary configuration information.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to collect the necessary configuration information.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: To collect <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration information
trans-unit.target: To collect <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration information

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Management service</ui>, click <ui>ManagementClient</ui>, and then click <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Management service</ui>, click <ui>ManagementClient</ui>, and then click <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Copy the value in the <ui>Password</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: Copy the value in the <ui>Password</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Get the value of your service namespace and <token>secondref_acs</token> host name.
trans-unit.target: Get the value of your service namespace and <token>secondref_acs</token> host name.

trans-unit.source: If your Management Service URL is http://contoso.accesscontrol.windows.net, the namespace is <system>contoso</system> and the host name is <system>accesscontrol.windows.net</system>.
trans-unit.target: If your Management Service URL is http://contoso.accesscontrol.windows.net, the namespace is <system>contoso</system> and the host name is <system>accesscontrol.windows.net</system>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Create a Sample Console Application
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Create a Sample Console Application

trans-unit.source: In this step you create a sample console application that can run the code for adding your <token>secondref_acs</token> rule groups and rules.
trans-unit.target: In this step you create a sample console application that can run the code for adding your <token>secondref_acs</token> rule groups and rules.

trans-unit.source: To create a sample console application
trans-unit.target: To create a sample console application

trans-unit.source: Open <token>vs_current_long</token> and create a new console application project under the <ui>Windows</ui> installed template.
trans-unit.target: Open <token>vs_current_long</token> and create a new console application project under the <ui>Windows</ui> installed template.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class and then assign serviceIdentityPasswordForManagement, serviceNamespace, and acsHostName variables to the appropriate configuration information that you collected in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class and then assign serviceIdentityPasswordForManagement, serviceNamespace, and acsHostName variables to the appropriate configuration information that you collected in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: In this step you identify and add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.
trans-unit.target: In this step you identify and add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.

trans-unit.source: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies
trans-unit.target: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies

trans-unit.source: Right-click <ui>References</ui>, click <ui>Add Reference</ui>, and add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <ui>References</ui>, click <ui>Add Reference</ui>, and add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.

trans-unit.source: You might have to right-click your sample console application name in the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, select <ui>Properties</ui>, and change the target framework of your sample application from <ui>.NET Framework 4 Client Profile</ui> (assigned by default when you create a new console application) to <ui>.NET Framework 4</ui>.
trans-unit.target: You might have to right-click your sample console application name in the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, select <ui>Properties</ui>, and change the target framework of your sample application from <ui>.NET Framework 4 Client Profile</ui> (assigned by default when you create a new console application) to <ui>.NET Framework 4</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click <ui>Service References</ui>, click <ui>Add Service Reference</ui>, and add a service reference to the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <ui>Service References</ui>, click <ui>Add Service Reference</ui>, and add a service reference to the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service
trans-unit.target: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service

trans-unit.source: Add the following declarations, where <userInput>MyConsoleApplication</userInput> is the name of your console application and <userInput>MyServiceReference</userInput> is the name of your service reference:
trans-unit.target: Add the following declarations, where <userInput>MyConsoleApplication</userInput> is the name of your console application and <userInput>MyServiceReference</userInput> is the name of your service reference:

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Implement the Management Service Client

trans-unit.source: In this step you implement the Management Service client.
trans-unit.target: In this step you implement the Management Service client.

trans-unit.source: To implement the Management Service client
trans-unit.target: To implement the Management Service client

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods to the <ui>Program</ui> class.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods to the <ui>Program</ui> class.

trans-unit.source: <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> and its helpers add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> and its helpers add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Add Certificates and Keys
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Add Certificates and Keys

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Certificate for Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Certificate for Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: In this example, you create an X.509 signing certificate for your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this example, you create an X.509 signing certificate for your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add a token signing certificate for all relying party applications in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: To add a token signing certificate for all relying party applications in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Create a <system>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</system> helper function to read bytes from your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Create a <system>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</system> helper function to read bytes from your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Replace "Full path to your .PFX file" with the valid full path to your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace "Full path to your .PFX file" with the valid full path to your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".
trans-unit.target: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".

trans-unit.source: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Certificate for a Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Certificate for a Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: In this example, you create an X.509 signing certificate that is assigned to a particular relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In this example, you create an X.509 signing certificate that is assigned to a particular relying party application.

trans-unit.source: How to add a token signing certificate for a relying party application
trans-unit.target: How to add a token signing certificate for a relying party application

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Create a helper function <userInput>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</userInput> to read bytes out of your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Create a helper function <userInput>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</userInput> to read bytes out of your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Replace "Full path to your .PFX file" with the full path to your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace "Full path to your .PFX file" with the full path to your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".
trans-unit.target: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".

trans-unit.source: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: Replace “MyRelyingPartyApplication” with the name of the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Replace “MyRelyingPartyApplication” with the name of the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Signing Symmetric Key for Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: In this example, you assign this signing symmetric key to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this example, you assign this signing symmetric key to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Add a Token Encryption Certificate
trans-unit.target: Add a Token Encryption Certificate

trans-unit.source: In this example, you add an X.509 token encryption certificate for a particular relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In this example, you add an X.509 token encryption certificate for a particular relying party application.

trans-unit.target: To add a token encryption certificate for a relying party application

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: To add a token encryption X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a token encryption X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Replace "Full path to your .CER file" with the full path to an X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace "Full path to your .CER file" with the full path to an X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.cer".
trans-unit.target: For example, "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.cer".

trans-unit.source: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for the X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Replace “MyCertificatePassword” with the password for the X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.target: Replace “MyRelyingPartyApplication” with the name of a relying party application.

trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service client by adding the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Create a helper function <userInput>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</userInput> to read bytes out of your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: Create a helper function <userInput>ReadBytesFromPfxFile</userInput> to read bytes out of your X.509 certificate by adding the following code to the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:
trans-unit.target: To add a token signing X.509 certificate, add the following code to the <ui>Main</ui> method in the <ui>Program</ui> class:

trans-unit.source: Substitute "Full path to your .PFX file" in the code below with the valid full path to your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Substitute "Full path to your .PFX file" in the code below with the valid full path to your X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a certificate called ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx is saved under C:\, the correct value is "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".
trans-unit.target: For example, if a certificate called ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx is saved under C:\, the correct value is "C:\ ACS2ClientCertificate.pfx".

trans-unit.source: Substitute “MyCertificatePassword” in the code below with the correct password for your X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: Substitute “MyCertificatePassword” in the code below with the correct password for your X.509 certificate.
